biogHist.abstract: Berry Street holds historical records relating to the out-of-home care services provided by Berry Street and its predecessors since 1877. Former residents (and their families) of the various orphanages, homes and other out-of-home care programs run by Berry Street or Sutherland Homes for Children and its predecessors can contact the Heritage and Background Information Service at Berry Street to gain access to records.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Heritage and Background Information Service, Berry Street - Contact Details

descriptiveNote.p: The Heritage and Background Information Service is part of Berry Street.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: 'Heritage and Background Information Service', in Find & Connect - Victoria,
Diamond Valley Hostel, Greensborough Unit, Admissions Register from 1 June 1979

archref.unittitle: Diamond Valley Hostel, Greensborough Unit, Admissions Register from 1 June 1979
archref.abstract: This is a photograph of the front cover of an Admissions Register, used by the Diamond Valley Hostel (run by Sutherland Homes for Children) to record information about young people in its 'care'.
archref.note: Permission to use or reproduce part or all of this image must be sought from Berry Street

archref.abstract: This is an image of the front cover of a register from Sutherland Homes for Children. It was used to record details about children in its 'care'. Sutherland Homes used this recordkeeping system, with entries about children recorded in the register alphabetically from 1908 to 1929.
archref.note: Permission to use or reproduce part or all of this image must be sought from Berry Street

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Victorian Infant Asylum, First Annual Report [front page]

archref.unittitle: Victorian Infant Asylum, First Annual Report [front page]
archref.abstract: This is an image of the front page of the First Report of the Committee of Management of the Victorian Infant Asylum for the year ending June 30th 1878.
archref.note: Permission to use or reproduce part or all of this image must be sought from Berry Street

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Foundling Hospital and Infants Home (Inc), Admittance Forms (1946-1949)

archref.unittitle: Foundling Hospital and Infants Home (Inc), Admittance Forms (1946-1949)
archref.abstract: This is a photograph of one of the 'red books' used by Foundling Hospital and Infants Home (Inc) to keep its bound Admittance Forms, which recorded personal information about infants in its 'care', and about their parents. The institution used these 'red books', from 1940 to 1974.
archref.note: Permission to use or reproduce part or all of this image must be sought from Berry Street

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Foundling Hospital and Infants' Home, Blank Admittance Form

archref.unittitle: Foundling Hospital and Infants' Home, Blank Admittance Form
archref.abstract:
This image shows a blank Admittance Form, used by the Foundling Hospital and Infants' Home. Typical information recorded about an infant in its Admittance Form included: Name of child; Date of admission; Details of parents or guardian. The institution used this format, with Admittance Forms bound in a 'red book', from 1940 to 1974.
Typical information recorded about an infant included: Name of child; Date of admission; Name of infant's mother and/or father; Religion and 'legitimacy' status of infant. This blank form dates from the 1940s - it included a field to provide details about the father's military service, if applicable.
archref.note: Permission to use or reproduce part or all of this image must be sought from Berry Street

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Berry Street, Register of Inmates [blank page]

archref.unittitle: Berry Street, Register of Inmates [blank page]
archref.abstract: This image shows a blank page from the Register of Inmates, a record kept by Berry Street (and its predecessor organisations, such as the Foundling Hospital and Infants' Home) to document the admissions and discharges of infants. The Register was used from 1877 (at the Victorian Infant Asylum) up to 1970 (when it was known as the Berry Street Babies' Home and Hospital).
archref.note: Permission to use or reproduce part or all of this image must be sought from Berry Street
